module.name: JsonComparer
module.descr: This unit provides the TJSONComparer class for comparing JSON data structures. The comparer performs deep comparison of JSON objects, arrays, and primitive values, reporting differences with path information. Floating-point values can be compared with configurable tolerance via the Epsilon property.

element.name: TJSONComparer
element.short: Class for comparing JSON data structures
element.descr: TJSONComparer provides functionality for deep comparison of JSON data structures. The class can compare JSON objects, arrays, and primitive values (null, boolean, number, string). Differences are reported with path information indicating the exact location of discrepancies. Floating-point numbers are compared using the configurable Epsilon tolerance value. Comparison errors are collected in a TStrings object provided during construction.

element.name: TJSONComparer.create
element.short: Creates a new JSON comparer instance
element.descr: Creates a new TJSONComparer instance with the specified error collection. The aErrors parameter must provide a valid TStrings object where comparison differences will be reported. The Epsilon property is initialized to 1E-8 for floating-point comparison tolerance.

element.name: TJSONComparer.create.aErrors
element.short: String list to collect comparison error messages

element.name: TJSONComparer.Compare
element.descr: Compares the aExpected and aActual JSON data structures recursively. Differences are reported to the error collection specified during construction. The method performs deep comparison of all JSON types including objects, arrays, and primitive values. For floating-point numbers, differences smaller than Epsilon are considered equal. Path information is included in error messages to identify the exact location of differences. A class method variant is also available that creates a temporary comparer instance.

element.name: TJSONComparer.Compare.aActual
element.short: The actual JSON data structure to compare

element.name: TJSONComparer.Compare.aErrors
element.short: String list to collect comparison error messages

element.name: TJSONComparer.Epsilon
element.descr: Epsilon specifies the tolerance used when comparing floating-point JSON numbers. Two floating-point values are considered equal if their absolute difference is less than or equal to Epsilon. The default value is 1E-8, providing reasonable precision for most JSON numeric comparisons. This property can be adjusted to accommodate different precision requirements.
